bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: The President of the United States of America,
To John M. Boyle, Esquire, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington,

We Command you, that you have the body of Fletcher Decker by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Fletcher Decker shall be called or charged, before the Hon. C. H. Manford Jeremiah Neterer, United States District Judge for the Western District of Washington, at the court room of said court in the City of Seattle in the Northern Division of said Western District of Washington, on the 13th day of September A.D. 189 1921, at ten o'clock in the fore-noon, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning him the said Fletcher Decker
And have you then and there this writ.

WITNESS the Hon. C.H. Hanford Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the United States District Court for the District of Washington, this 9th day of September in the year of our Lord one thousand eight nine hundred and twenty-one.

In obedience to the within writ I have the body of within named Fletcher Decker before the Court this 13th day of September 1921 as clerk Commanded and herewrit marthed is the complaint amended complaint warrant testimony and judgment and commitment at a hearing held before R.W. Mallelellau U.S. Commisioner and extradition commissioner upon which record he is now held. In extradition to the Province of Saska of Canada
